title.revision: PW4000: Inspection of the Area Between the TT3 Boss and the Bracket Boss

summary.para: A number of diffuser cases have been found to have cracks in the outer wall between the TT3 boss and the round bracket boss. The cracking adjacent to the TT3 boss is caused by high stress levels resulting from the proximity of the bosses to each other, combined with undetectable porosity during the casting process. The purpose of this EO is to verify that all UPS PW4000 engines are in compliance with Pratt and Whitney Alert Service Bulletin A72–681.

para.revision: This Engineering Order authorizes continued operation of the effective aircraft when the actions specified herein are accomplished as specified in Paragraph 4. — TIMETABLE.
Pratt and Whitney Alert Service Bulletin PW4ENG A72-681 Revision 2, dated June 20, 2005

l1item.para: For diffuser cases PN 50J713-001 or 50J779-001 that have not been Fluorescent Penetrant Inspected perform the inspection within 250 cycles before the case accumulates 2000 CSN. For cases that have accumulated 2000 cycles verify that the case was Fluorescent Penetrant Inspected either during the last shop visit or on-wing. If no records of inspection were found, inspect within 250 cycles. These diffuser cases should be reinspected at 1000 cycles thereafter.

For diffuser cases PN 50J713-D02, 50J779-002, or 50J779-D03 that have not been Fluorescent Penetrant Inspected perform the inspection within 250 cycles before the case accumulates 3000 CSN. For cases that have accumulated 3000 cycles, verify that the case was Fluorescent Penetrant Inspected either during the last shop visit or on-wing. If no records of inspection were found, inspect within 250 cycles. These diffuser cases should be reinspected at 3000 cycles thereafter.

resource.para: Accomplishment of this EO will require 3.0 labor hours.

l1item.para: Issue DMIIMPI when requested per . DMI time intervals are defined by findings in .

para.revision: Accomplish the intent of this EO during Aircraft Transition checks if the initial inspection or repetitive inspection is within 300 cycles of the due date.

l1item.para: Refer to and make sure gateways accomplishing this EO have sufficient supply of material outlined.

l2item.para: Maintain the current effectivity of this EO. Update the forecast based upon TIMETABLE and engine shop records package.
Incorporation of Pratt & Whitney SB 72-699 and/or 72-710 during engine shop visit are the terminating action for this EO.

note.para: Service Bulletins 72-699 and 72-710 modify the engine diffuser case. Engine diffuser cases can be swapped between engines during engine shop visits. Diffuser cases cannot be swapped during line maintenance of the engine.

l2item.para: Summary: Updated Effectivity list and in Appendix A changed Fluorescent Penetrant from ZL-27A to RC77.
Summary: Updated Effectivity list. Added terminating action statement for Aircraft Records.
Retroactivity: Remove ESN 733754 from forecast due to accomplishment of terminating action during last shop visit.

Summary: Updated Effectivity list to PW4460 Swiss MD11 ESN’s, new spare ESN’s, and 733754. Added PW4158 ESN’s. All ESN’s are now included in the EO due to the to the possibility of diffuser case swaps at engine shop visits. Added Actions By for AMC to create DMI based on inspection findings.

Summary: Updated work steps to include A300 references.Corrected PN ST1061-16 to ST1061-06 in work steps 2 and 8 of Appendix B. Updated the PW4460 effectivity. Revised Authorization to reference revision 2 of Pratt and Whitney Alert Service Bulletin PW4ENG A72-681 .
Summary: Revised Appendix B, Step 4 by requiring MECH and INSP sign-offs.

Summary: Corrected PN ST1061-16 to ST1061-06 in work steps 2 and 8 of Appendix B. Updated the PW4460 effectivity. Revised Authorization to reference revision 2 of Pratt and Whitney Alert Service Bulletin PW4ENG A72-681.
Summary: Added diffuser case PN 50J779-003 as P/N to be flourescent penetrant inspected per Paragraph 4.B.
Summary: Updated General Information Page (GIP) to current format.
Retroactivity: Added ESN 728589, 728593, 728598, and 729085 to Effectivity.

para.revision: Added ESN 723808 and ESN 723922 to Effectivity.
Closed Inspector sjgn-off block in Appendix B, Steps (4) and (5). This inspection is not an RII item and may be performed by a mechanic in accordance with GMM 04.10.01.04.

prtreqd.prv: All gateways accomplishing this EO should have outlined parts in stock at all times.

appendix.workinst:
Work Instructions&RII_caution;
Open the fan cowl and thrust reverser halves per MD11 AMM 71–10–00 or A300 AMM 71–13–00.
On the diffuser case, located at the 10 o’clock position when viewed from the rear, remove the front hose clamp, PN ST1061–06 from the pressure shield assembly, PN 51T607. Refer to and .
Remove the lockwire, the two bolts (PN MS9576–01), the two washers (PN MS9321-11) and the bracket assembly (PN 54T732-01) from the diffuser case located at the 10 o'clock position when viewed from rear. Retain the removed hardware and bracket. Refer to and .
Accomplish Fluorescent Penetrant Inspection (FPI) per MD11 AMM 70-10-05 or A300 AMM 70-00-00-2, SPOP 70 (ultra high). FPI the diffuser case between the Oval Boss (TT3 Boss) and Round Bracket Boss which is located at approximately the 10 o'clock position when viewed from rear and 8 inches forward of M flange. Refer to .
Did FPI reveal any cracks on the diffuser case? Refer to
NO — Proceed to
YES — Record the total crack length “A” and longest individual crack length “B” below.
Total Crack Length “A” __________________ (in).
Longest Individual Crack Length “B” __________________ (in).
The limits in the table below only apply to longest individual crack length “B”.
Crack Length “B” (in)
Reinspection Interval
0 — 0.032
No Action
0.032 — 1.00
500 Cycles
1.0 — 1.3
100 Cycles
1.3 — 1.5
5 Cycles
Greater than 1.5
Remove engine from service
If the longest individual crack length is greater than 0.032 in. contact AMC and obtain a DMI based on the reinspection interval outlined in . If the crack length is greater than 1.5 in. immediate engine change is required. If the crack length is less than or equal to 0.032 in., N/A this step and proceed to .
Install bracket assembly (PN 54T732–01) using the retained washers (PN MS9321–11) and bolts (PN MS9576–01). Coat bolts with engine oil and torque to 125 -170 Ib-in and lockwire the bolts. Refer to and .
Install the front hose clamp, PN ST1061-06 on the pressure shield assembly, PN 51T607. Refer to and .
Close the fan cowl and thrust reverser halves per the MD11 AMM 71-10-00, or the A300 AMM 71-13-00. &Restore_config_signoff;&WAN_signoff;&APP_complete_signoff;
Location of Bracket PN 54T732–01 and Boss Cover PN 50J760
